org.opends.server.util

Class Platform

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.util.Platform

  • public final class Platform
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a wrapper class that collects all of the JVM vendor and JDK version specific code in a single place.

    • Method Detail

      • addCertificate

        public static void addCertificate(java.security.KeyStore ks,
                  java.lang.String ksType,
                  java.lang.String ksPath,
                  java.lang.String alias,
                  char[] pwd,
                  java.lang.String certPath)
                           throws java.security.KeyStoreException
        Add the certificate in the specified path to the provided keystore; creating the keystore with the provided type and path if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        ks - The keystore to add the certificate to, may be null if it doesn't exist.
        ksType - The type to use if the keystore is created.
        ksPath - The path to the keystore if it is created.
        alias - The alias to store the certificate under.
        pwd - The password to use in saving the certificate.
        certPath - The path to the file containing the certificate.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyStoreException - If an error occurred adding the certificate to the keystore.

      • deleteAlias

        public static void deleteAlias(java.security.KeyStore ks,
               java.lang.String ksPath,
               java.lang.String alias,
               char[] pwd)
                        throws java.security.KeyStoreException
        Delete the specified alias from the provided keystore.
        Parameters:
        ks - The keystore to delete the alias from.
        ksPath - The path to the keystore.
        alias - The alias to use in the request generation.
        pwd - The keystore password to use.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyStoreException - If an error occurred deleting the alias.

      • generateSelfSignedCertificate

        public static void generateSelfSignedCertificate(java.security.KeyStore ks,
                                 java.lang.String ksType,
                                 java.lang.String ksPath,
                                 java.lang.String alias,
                                 char[] pwd,
                                 java.lang.String dn,
                                 int validity)
                                          throws java.security.KeyStoreException
        Generate a self-signed certificate using the specified alias, dn string and validity period. If the keystore does not exist, it will be created using the specified keystore type and path.
        Parameters:
        ks - The keystore to save the certificate in. May be null if it does not exist.
        ksType - The keystore type to use if the keystore is created.
        ksPath - The path to the keystore if the keystore is created.
        alias - The alias to store the certificate under.
        pwd - The password to us in saving the certificate.
        dn - The dn string used as the certificate subject.
        validity - The validity of the certificate in days.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyStoreException - If the self-signed certificate cannot be generated.

      • normalize

        public static void normalize(java.lang.StringBuilder buffer)
        Normalize the specified buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to normalize.

      • isVendor

        public static boolean isVendor(java.lang.String vendor)
        Test if a platform java vendor property starts with the specified vendor string.
        Parameters:
        vendor - The vendor to check for.
        Returns:
        true if the java vendor starts with the specified vendor string.

      • getUsableMemoryForCaching

        public static long getUsableMemoryForCaching()
        Calculates the usable memory which could potentially be used by the application for caching objects. This method does not look at the amount of free memory, but instead tries to query the JVM's GC settings in order to determine the amount of usable memory in the old generation (or equivalent). More specifically, applications may also need to take into account the amount of memory already in use, for example by performing the following: 
         Runtime runTime = Runtime.getRuntime();
 runTime.gc();
 runTime.gc();
 long freeCommittedMemory = runTime.freeMemory();
 long uncommittedMemory = runTime.maxMemory() - runTime.totalMemory();
 long freeMemory = freeCommittedMemory + uncommittedMemory;
        Returns:
        The usable memory which could potentially be used by the application for caching objects.
